pull_request.title: CBG-3268 remove RespRevID and prepare for HLV aware testing
pull_request.body:
- Switch uses of explicitly rev checks to `PutDoc` and `UpdateDoc` when appropriate.
- For branching revisions, adapted `PutNewEditsFalse` to allow putting specific versions. Much of this code won't work with HLV, but it seemed easier to port this anyway, and if we do keep this code.
- switch some cases from `t.Run` to `rt.Run` to make assertions not panic

## Pre-review checklist
- [x] Removed debug logging (`fmt.Print`, `log.Print`, ...)
- [x] Logging sensitive data? Make sure it's tagged (e.g. `base.UD(docID)`, `base.MD(dbName)`)
- [x] Updated relevant information in the API specifications (such as endpoint descriptions, schemas, ...) in `docs/api`

## [Integration Tests](https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/build?delay=0sec)
- [ ] `GSI=true,xattrs=true` https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/2147/

pull_request.title: CBG-3268 replace WaitForRev with WaitForVersion
pull_request.body:
Replaces `WaitForRev` with `WaitForVersion` to remove rev id assertions. When reviewing this:

- Look for dropped conceptual assertions
- Look for unintentional or unwaited drops in whether the request is user or admin scoped (`PutDoc`, `UpdateDoc`, `DeleteDoc` are admin scoped.
- Make sure there are no dropped `WaitForPendingChanges` or other things that can cause race conditions.

Fails lint CI due to https://github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/pull/6555

## Pre-review checklist
- [x] Removed debug logging (`fmt.Print`, `log.Print`, ...)
- [x] Logging sensitive data? Make sure it's tagged (e.g. `base.UD(docID)`, `base.MD(dbName)`)
- [x] Updated relevant information in the API specifications (such as endpoint descriptions, schemas, ...) in `docs/api`

## [Integration Tests](https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/build?delay=0sec)
- [x] `GSI=true,xattrs=true` https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/2138/

review.body: A few areas that need a second look.

pull_request.title: CBG-3211: Add PutExistingRev for HLV
pull_request.body:
CBG-3211

Adds a new function entitled PutExistingCurrentVersion which carries much the same functionality for PutExistingRev but carries out logic on the HLV.  
- Check for conflict between the two HLV's  
- If conflict is found we cancel the rest of the update to the doc. Here we need to add merge version and send the doc back to the client.  
- If not in conflict we need to add all newer source/version pairs from the incoming HLV to the local HLV for that doc. I have added a function called AddNewerVersions that does this, first by iterating through the Previous Versions and adding any newer version pair, then the incoming HLV's current version pair. 
- If not in conflict the revtree entry still needs to be computed and added to the doc update. 
- Added tests to ensure that the CV of the incoming HLV is preserved and that the cvCAS is updated still, then the PV of the HLV on the doc is updated correctly. 
- Also included a test where a conflict is found and assert we cancel the doc update, then fetch the persisted sync data to ensure it has remained unchanged. 


## Pre-review checklist
- [x] Removed debug logging (`fmt.Print`, `log.Print`, ...)
- [x] Logging sensitive data? Make sure it's tagged (e.g. `base.UD(docID)`, `base.MD(dbName)`)
- [x] Updated relevant information in the API specifications (such as endpoint descriptions, schemas, ...) in `docs/api`

## [Integration Tests](https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/build?delay=0sec)
- [x] `GSI=true,xattrs=true` https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/2096/

comment.body:
We don't expect callers of PutExistingCurrentVersion to be providing a revision history as well (docHistory). 

As mentioned on the ticket, this function should be computing a new revID for the mutation, similar to Put.

commits.message: changeCache updateStats only needs a read lock (#6558)

pull_request.title: Drop changeCache.updateStats() lock to read lock
pull_request.body:
The method doesn't write to any fields on the struct. Doesn't need to hold the full lock.

Avoids contention with the read locks in `getNextSequence()`/`getInitialSequence()`.

pull_request.title: CBG-3209: Add cv index and retrieval for revision cache
pull_request.body:
CBG-3209

- Added CV to document revision struct
- Added loader function for CV that returns revid for puprose of populating revID lookup map 
- Added relevant interface definitions to add support for lookup by CV 
- Two ways to remove from cache, one from CV and another by revid, removes from both lookup maps when requesting to remove from cache
- Added getValueByCV which will retrieve value by CV, then if not found and create is true then will create this value and add to the cache, updating both revID lookup and CV lookup maps
- Altered upsert behaviour to work with CV too 
- Loader functiosn return revid/cv wherever appropriate for purpose fo populating opposite lookup map 
- Two functions `addToCVLookupPostRevLoad` `addToRevLookupPostCVLoad` to add to opposite lookup map 
- Chnaged a test that was running resync with xatrrs disabled. This caused my PR to panic as we assume xattrs are there as they aren't supported for this release. 

All in all the changes to add support for CV lookup, i've ensured that this is alongside alongside the RevID lookup in case we get legacy clients requesting for revs via the revID. Thus need both ways to lookup until backwards compatibility is removed. Likewise  if we communicate with a non HLV aware client and we receive a new doc/doc update over replicator we need a way to update rev cache with that rev supplied.  I have split some function out into separate functions to keep revID lookups and CV lookups separate. 

In addition in the loader code for CV `revCacheLoaderForDocumentCV` we need to have the concept of channel removal by CV for the checking if a doc was a channel removal.

Added tests to test the various operations on the cache and test that eviction also woks as expected.

`currentChannels` function implementation is taken from, Ben's PR for CBG-3203

## Pre-review checklist
- [ ] Removed debug logging (`fmt.Print`, `log.Print`, ...)
- [ ] Logging sensitive data? Make sure it's tagged (e.g. `base.UD(docID)`, `base.MD(dbName)`)
- [ ] Updated relevant information in the API specifications (such as endpoint descriptions, schemas, ...) in `docs/api`

## Dependencies (if applicable)
- [ ] Link upstream PRs
- [ ] Update Go module dependencies when merged

## [Integration Tests](https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/build?delay=0sec)
- [x] `GSI=true,xattrs=true` https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/2130/ (known flake)

pull_request.body:
CBG-3209

- Added CV to document revision struct
- Added loader function for CV that returns revid for puprose of populating revID lookup map 
- Added relevant interface definitions to add support for lookup by CV 
- Two ways to remove from cache, one from CV and another by revid, removes from both lookup maps when requesting to remove from cache
- Added getValueByCV which will retrieve value by CV, then if not found and create is true then will create this value and add to the cache, updating both revID lookup and CV lookup maps
- Altered upsert behaviour to work with CV too 
- Loader functiosn return revid/cv wherever appropriate for purpose fo populating opposite lookup map 
- Two functions `addToCVLookupPostRevLoad` `addToRevLookupPostCVLoad` to add to opposite lookup map 
- Chnaged a test that was running resync with xatrrs disabled. This caused my PR to panic as we assume xattrs are there as they aren't supported for this release. 

All in all the changes to add support for CV lookup, i've ensured that this is alongside alongside the RevID lookup in case we get legacy clients requesting for revs via the revID. Thus need both ways to lookup until backwards compatibility is removed. Likewise  if we communicate with a non HLV aware client and we receive a new doc/doc update over replicator we need a way to update rev cache with that rev supplied.  I have split some function out into separate functions to keep revID lookups and CV lookups separate. 

In addition in the loader code for CV `revCacheLoaderForDocumentCV` we need to have the concept of channel removal by CV for the checking if a doc was a channel removal.

Added tests to test the various operations on the cache and test that eviction also woks as expected.

comment.body: Updated to fix this to look for specific versions.

pull_request.title: CBG-3268 replace WaitForRev with WaitForVersion
pull_request.body:
Replaces `WaitForRev` with `WaitForVersion` to remove rev id assertions. When reviewing this:

- Look for dropped conceptual assertions
- Look for unintentional or unwaited drops in whether the request is user or admin scoped (`PutDoc`, `UpdateDoc`, `DeleteDoc` are admin scoped.
- Make sure there are no dropped `WaitForPendingChanges` or other things that can cause race conditions.

Fails lint CI due to https://github.com/couchbase/sync_gateway/pull/6555

## Pre-review checklist
- [x] Removed debug logging (`fmt.Print`, `log.Print`, ...)
- [x] Logging sensitive data? Make sure it's tagged (e.g. `base.UD(docID)`, `base.MD(dbName)`)
- [x] Updated relevant information in the API specifications (such as endpoint descriptions, schemas, ...) in `docs/api`

## [Integration Tests](https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/build?delay=0sec)
- [x] `GSI=true,xattrs=true` https://jenkins.sgwdev.com/job/SyncGateway-Integration/2138/
